newsitem.title: USA: Belmont Homes CEO takes medical leave.
newsitem.headline: Belmont Homes CEO takes medical leave.

text.p: Belmont Homes Inc said on Monday that Jerold Kennedy, president and chief executive officer, has decided to take a medical leave of absence from his offices.
The company said it has named John Allison, a director of the company and president of its Spirit Homes subsidiary, as acting president and chief executive office.
On March 28, Kennedy was taken to a hospital, where imaging tests revealed the presence of four, possibly cancerous lesions on his brain.
Kennedy expects to begin radiation therapy for these lesions March 31.
In November 1996, the company announced that Kennedy had been diagnosed with a small, cancerous lung tumor.
